loans.use: To purchaseof mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Gunkeshari

texts.en:
Gun Keshari M. lives in a single family dwelling with her husband and two sons. She lives in Thecho, in the Lalitpur district. Thecho is famous for vegetable farming. Her older son makes traditional idols and her younger son is studying in grade 7. Her husband, Mr. Santa Lal M. is a carpenter.

Mrs. M. opened her tailoring shop 6 years ago. Her specialty is making ladies dresses. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies long dresses, Makhshi, and other items. Before starting her own business, Mrs. M. took a 4-month training course in tailoring. With her first loan she was able to purchase clothes and equipment for her work.

Now she needs Rs30,000 to buy supplies for her tailoring work.

loans.use: to buys supplies for her tailoring work

loans.name: Panji

texts.en:
K. Panji is 46 years, married with 4 children. From an early age he dedicated himself to working the land, having inherited perseverance for this type of work from his parents. He plants different types of vegetables like: wheat, onion, watermelon, etc. Panji has regular clients to his crops, which means his crops have an assured sale. The funds he requests are for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. Panji is a hard worker and he believes in the importance of working really hard on his land in order to enable him to get the best results so that he can improve his family's living, put away savings and repay his loan on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Umirnisso

texts.en:
Umirnisso is a married woman with three adult children. She runs a grocery business selling different kinds of foodstuffs. Her twenty eight years of being in business have helped her store flourish into a successful enterprise. Umirnisso would like to see her business grow still further. She believes additional financial assistance will help guarantee expansion and higher profits. Umirnisso’s integrity, good reputation, stability and rich experience working in commerce should secure prompt repayment of this loan and consistent progress in her business.

loans.use: foodstuff like sweets, tea, sugar, juices, soft drinks, preserved food

loans.name: Tulshi Maiya

texts.en: Mrs. Tulshi Maiya M., 54, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, Nepal. Thecho is one of the beautiful, under-developed villages of Nepal. Most of the people of this region are poor and depend on agriculture to make a living. Mrs. M. has three sons, all of them working. Four years ago, she opened a grocery shop selling items such as rice, maize, pulses (legumes), biscuits and noodles. (Her children also help her in her work.) The demand for grocery goods is increasing in her area, so she is requesting a loan of NPR 10,000 to buy items to meet the demand.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Mukhtor

texts.en:
M. Mukhtor is 22 years old. He has great passion for dairy farming and has been in this business for six years together with his father. He would like to expand his business by adding another cow to the ones he has. This is because recently he acquired orders from outside town to supply milk. Mukhtor is requesting $800 USD in order to buy another cow and feed for it. With additional income Mukhtor will be better able to contribute more to his family's finances.

loans.use: Purchase cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Abdulkodir

texts.ru: Джалилов Абдулкодир проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Джалилов Абдулкодир работает в области торговли более 15 лет. Он продает продукты в собственом магазине. Кредит барет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Abdulkodir D. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 57 years old, married and has 2 children. Abdulkodir has been working in the retail field for over 15 years. He sells food products in his own store. He is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Saidahmad

texts.en: N. Saidahmad is 25 years old, is married, and has one child. For more than five years Saidahmad has been selling vegetables such as potatoes, onion, carrots, etc. His business begins early in the morning at 5:00 a.m. Saidahmad buys vegetables from the local farmers wholesale and sells them in the market. Moreover, he is trading in a market that is known among people because of the attractive prices. All this allows Saidahmad’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for his family. Today, Saidahmad is planning to purchase new, fresh vegetables to sell in order to increase the range of his goods. With this purpose in mind he requests 6,000 Somoni. Having a positive credit history with IMON, Saidahmad promises to repay the current loan promptly as he did the previous time. The well-being of this family is in your hands. loans.use: To increase the range of vegetables he sells

loans.name: Ram Keshari

texts.en:
Ram Keshari M. is a 24 years old woman who lives in Thecho, in the Lalitpur district of Kathmandu Valley.  Most people who live in this region are farmers. She lives with her husband and daughter.

Her husband, Dadu Raj M. is a carpenter and he opened his furniture shop three years ago.  All of the family's needs are met using his income.  Ram Keshari seeks a loan of Rs30,000 to buy lumber to help her husband's furniture business grow. Her husband makes beds, tables and chairs.

loans.use: Buys woods for furniture making.

loans.name: Oimunos

texts.en:
Vegetable farming is a traditional occupation for many people living in Tajikistan.  Having a fairly large amount of land surrounding Oimunos'  house, this mother of four decided to growing vegetables.  Neither she nor her husband have been able to find steady employment.  Oimunos has experience growing and selling produce and wants to do more to generate more income for her family.  She requests a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds so she can grow her business.  Oimunos sincerely thank you for your generous heart.   
--------------------------------------------------------------------

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Nelanie

texts.en:
Nelanie M. is from Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Nelanie owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp in the local community.  Nelanie has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Nelanie joined ASKI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Nelanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI to purchase products to sell.  Nelanie is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering.  This loan will be her second from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 
-------------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase new items to sell.

loans.name: Erasto

texts.en:
Erasto is 64 years old and is married with three children aged between 16 and 21. He lives with his family in Ruhengeli, Gakenke district, in the Northern Province of Rwanda. His region is called Gashenyi where his business is located.

Erasto sells leather. He was a farmer but he could not earn enough to supply all needs for his family, which is the reason why he prefers to be a businessman rather than a farmer. Since he started his business he is able to sort out some of the problems in his family.

Erasto has been an entrepreneur for many years and employs five people from his community who help him to collect the animal skins from the different villages. The hours of his business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Erasto is requesting his loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company so that he can expand his business through purchasing more animal skins. Once his plan is successful, he hopes to earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to save money for his children and to improve his family situation.

By the way, Erasto is quite an old man and hardworking. We don’t doubt that his target will be reached.

loans.use: To purchase more animal skins to sell

loans.name: Wanyonyi

texts.en: V., 39 years old, is a single lady with one daughter, who is in school.  She has been running a cafe named Shalom Chips Poiny, where she sells mainly chips and beverages. She has two employees. She appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her save money. She hopes to succeed in her business, which is why she requested the Kes.40,000 loan to increase her stock. V.'s dream is to buy a car and own a house in the future.  She describes herself as a humble and hardworking lady.

loans.use: To increase stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: C8323 Abunzubumwe Group

texts.en:
Elie is 47 years old. He is married, but does not have children. He lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda. Elie is the representative of group called Abunzubmwe in Kinyarwanda, the local language.This loan group has 10 members who have different business.

Elie has his own clothing shop in the Gakenke district of the Northern Province, which is approximately 2 hours drive from the capital city. He has 6 years of experience selling various styles of clothes. His shop is open from 6:00 AM to 16:00 PM every day except Saturday.

Elie is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance to expands his business by purchasing more various styles for men and woman. With this loan, Elie hopes to attract more customers to his shop and, hopefully, to earn more profit in the process. This, in turn, will help him to save money to buy a car to be used in his business.

loans.use: To buy various styles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Bela

texts.en: Bela D., 36, lives in Semyonovka.  She has worked at a local school for five years as a  librarian.  Bela lives with her husband, son and daughter in a private house.  During the last 10 years she and her husband have also been busy as farmers.  They have some cows and a calf.  All of the profits from farming are spent to meet the family's needs.  Bela asks for 1.100.000 AMD loan to buy some sheep and fodder for her farm animals.

loans.use: Buy sheep and fodder for her farm animals.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is married and has seven children, whom he has seen through school. His wife is a businesswoman and he runs a wholesale shop where he sells food and employs three employees. Previously, Faulu Kenya offered him a loan which helped him add stock, expand his business and educate his children.  

He intends to add stock and expand his store with the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan. Thomas hopes to buy rental houses and a car for his business. His dream is to have more shops. Thomas describes himself as hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: To add more stock and expand the store

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 33-year-old married man with three children who are in school. His wife does tailoring while he does mining and sells sand and ballast. He has been running Kolwamba Co. for seven years. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, for helping him boost his business stock.  

He has requested a 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan to enable him to add stock, such as sand and ballast. His dream is to own a home in the Rongai area in Nairobi. He describes himself as a faithful and a hardworking man.

loans.use: Add stock of sand and ballast

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gustave

texts.en:
Gustave is 23 years old. He is single and he cares for three dependents from his family. He lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda, in the village called Gakenke, where his business is located. This province is a tourism region, the location of Volcanoes National Park, home to the famed mountain gorillas.

Gustave has a retail shop where he sells different kinds of products such as cosmetics, toilet paper, water, and toothpaste. He prefers this business because can use his own house in his business, which is a great opportunity for him. His business is very organized. He employs one person as a helper so that his business runs smoothly. Gustave has been in this field for three years. The hours of his shop are from 6:00 AM to 8:00 PM every day, even on the weekend.

Gustave is requesting this loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more goods at a good price to attract more customers. After this target is reached, Gustave will be able to serve more customers and earn more profits, which will allow him to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Хусайнов Сафарали проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 28 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Хусайнов Сафарали имеет высшее образование по специальности "Налоговик". Растениеводством занимается более 15 лет. Хусайнов Сафарали сажает деревья. Кредит берет для посева урожая.
texts.en:
Sarafali H. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 28 years old, married and has 2 children. Sarafali has a higher education as a tax collector. He has been involved in horticulture for over 15 years. Sarafali plants trees. He is requesting this loan for the new crop planting.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New crop planting

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles O. O. is thirty years old, is married and has two children. His business is located in Kisumu town centre along Oginga Odinga Street where for two years he has been selling electronics such as DVDs, VCDs, amplifiers, video decks and radios.

Charles’ major challenge is harassment by the local government. He also does not have permanent premises from which to run his business but he hopes that in the future he will own a shop within the town centre and supply electronics in large quantities. He also hopes that he will get a permanent place to do his business therefore retaining his customers.

Charles is using his loan to add stock to expand his business. He is hardworking, polite and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy more DVDs, video decks, VCDs and amplifiers to sell

loans.name: Cuento Contigo Group

texts.en:
This village bank is called “Cuento Contigo” (Count on Me) and is composed of 16 members.  The primary activities of the businesses in this group are making artisan crafts from plaster, selling various articles of clothing, and selling quick and small meals such as empanadas (folded, stuffed pastries), sopaipillas (fried bread), and mote con huesillo (cooked wheat in a sweet peach syrup-based drink).  These meals are all very typical and traditional meals in Chile.

Francisca is a member of “Cuento Contigo,” and in the photo above, she is on the right-hand side dressed in a sleeveless blue shirt.  She runs a paqueteria (a place to rent luggage storage lockers) near the bus terminal in Talca, which she runs on her own.  Francisca also makes paper bags, paintings on glass, and ornaments using seeds, products that she also sells from her paquetería.  Her plan is to have a greater variety of novelty goods, so she can expand her client base.  Francisca plans to invest this loan in merchandise related to Valentine’s Day coming up on February 14.  Her dream is to own her own home and a permanent location for her business.

Village bank “Cuento Contigo” is located in Talca.  Talca is a city in the region of Maule in central Chile.  The residents of this area typically work in the rural sector and on farms.  Maule is known for its artisan goods and colonial architecture.  It has beautiful flora and fauna, as well as wineries.  Despite the hardworking nature of its residents, Maule continues to be one of the poorest regions of Chile.

loans.use: Merchandise, including gifts such as stuffed animals

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a 37 year old married man with two children who are both in school.  He sells fruits and drinks and employs one person. His business is located in the Kwa Reuben slums in Nairobi.  His wife does farming and business.  He earns extra income from selling household items.  He appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping him educate his children and expand his business, therefore raising his family's standard of living.  He intends to add stock such as fruits and start up a butchery with the Kes. 40,000 loan.  Daniel hopes to expand his business and open up several shops in the future.  His dream is to become an employer to more people and expand his business.  He describes himself as hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: To add stock of fruit.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.ru: Раджабов Рахмат проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Раджабов Рахмат имеет среднее Техническое образование по специальности "Шофер". Животноводством занимается более 11 лет. Раджабов Рахмат откарливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Rahmat R. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 57 years old, married and has 4 children. Rahmat has a secondary technical education as a driver. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 11 years. Rahmat raises and sells livestock. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is a 26-year-old single businesswoman. Francoise lives in Kayonza, a region of Rwamagana in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She has been in the butchering business for 2 years. She employs two people from her community. Her business working hours are from 8:00 AM until late in the afternoon hours every day.

As her meat business keeps growing, Francoise get more customers every day, so that one cow per day is not enough. Francoise is requesting a Kiva loan through Vision Finance Company. With this loan, she will also buy a refrigerator, which will allow her to keep the meats that she sells to her customers fresher. If this plan is successful, Francoise expects to gain more profits and reinvest them in the other businesses as well as building a secure future for herself.

loans.use: To buy one more cow to get meat to sell

loans.name: Marcellah

texts.en: Marcellah is 41 years old, married and has six children who are in school.  She sells water and also rents houses while her husband is a businessman.  She has been in the business since 2005.  Previously, she used to run a green grocery shop.   Currently, she earns extra income from her Posho mill.  She appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her educate her children and put up water pumps for sale.  She requested a Kes. 60,000 loan to enable her to increase her stock of cereals and grains.  Marcellah  hopes to own more rental houses, to expand her business and employ people.  She describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To add stock of cereals, grains and maize.

loans.name: Wellingtone

texts.en: Wellingtone is a 25 year old single man.  He runs a printing and stationary shop named Tenark Enterprises in a very competitive environment.  He has one employee.  Previously, he was employed as a cashier in a hotel.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been economically empowered and also has had an opportunity to interact with other business people and share business ideas.  He is requesting for a Kes. 50,000 loan from Faulu Kenya to buy a computer and a printer. He hopes to grow his business and create employment for other people.  He describes himself as humble and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a printer

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian A. O. is 24 years old, married and has one baby girl of 2. She sells clothes to the people of Kisumu, something she has been doing for three years. Specifically, she sells pants, clothes and shawls. She is taking a loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more stock to expand her business. Her major challenge is weather changes, i.e when it rains she is really affected due to the fact that she sells her products in the open air. There are also so many people in the area engaging in the same kind of business as hers and so there are no loyal customers as they are spoiled for choice. 

In the future she wants to own a boutique and she dreams of buying herself a car and building herself a permanent house. She is hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: Clothes

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 27 years old and he is still single. Innocent lives in Musanze, a region of Ruhengeri in the Northern Province of Rwanda. From Musanze to Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda, takes two hours by a taxi. Innocent owns a shop In Musanze where he sell a variety of goods, including drinks, which are usually sold in a shop, as the picture indicates. His shop is open from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM every day.

After two years of experience selling various goods in his shop, Innocent is now requesting a Kiva loan through Vision Finance Company to expand his business meaningfully by purchasing some additional goods. With those additional goods, which are demanded by a number of his customers, Innocent hopes that he will earn more profits. He will reinvest some of the profits in his business, and save the remainder for his future.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for his shop

loans.name: Saidikrom

texts.ru: Темуров Саидикром проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Темуров Саидикром имеет высшее образование по специальности "Педагог". Торговлей занимается более 8 лет. Темуров Саидикром  покупает и продает продукты. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Saidikrom T. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 40 years old, married and has 2 children. Saidikrom has a higher education as a teacher. He has been involved in the retail sales for over 8 years. Saidikrom buys and sells food products. He is requesting a loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Natalio

texts.es:
Natalio vive en la zona Alto Llojeta, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y   sus hijos menores, los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar.
 
Trabaja como chofer propietario de taxi en una de las céntricas rutas de la ciudad, su esposa tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la reparación del motor de su vehiculo ya que por el constante uso sufre de mal funcionamiento.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, y el segundo vía KIVA;  la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Natalio lives in the zone Alto Llojeta of the city El Alto. He lives in his house with his wife and their young children who are school age. He works as a driver and owner of a taxi in one of the central routes of the city. His wife has a small grocery store in their home. The loan will be used to repair his vehicle’s motor, as it is malfunctioning due to constant use. This is his second loan with Impro and the second via KIVA. The completed evaluation qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of repairing the motor of his taxi

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 46 years old and married, and he has 7 children. Emmanuel lives in Burera, a region of Ruhengeri in the Northern Province of Rwanda. Here, Emmanuel is a taxi driver, and this is his 10th successful year in this profession. Emmanuel starts his job at 5:00 AM and works until late in the evening hours every day except Sunday. 

After 10 years in driving a taxi, Emmanuel has an idea of selling the needed spare parts for a taxi so that he can make profits om addition to what he gets from driving. To achieve this, he is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, he hopes to earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to continue taking care of his family and building a secure future for them.

loans.use: Additional taxi spare parts

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 31 years old. He is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 20 years. He also cares for one orphan. Jean Paul lives in Kimironko where he owns a shop selling a variety of goods, including food and cosmetics. This is his 2nd successful year in this business. His working hours are from 7 AM to 8 PM every day.

Jean Paul is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more goods, including food, like rice, peas, and corn flour, because they seem to be in higher demand than other goods sold in his shop.  If the sale of these additional goods is as successful as is expected, Jean Paul will earn more profit which, in turn, will allow him to continue taking care of his children and building a secure future for them.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Asadullo

texts.ru: Табаров Асадулло проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Табаров Асадулло таксистом работает более 7 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en:
Asadullo T. lives in the Vahdat district. He is 38 years old, married and has 2 children. Asadullo has been working as a taxi driver for over 7 years. He is requesting this loan for car repairs in order to provide safe service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Maria Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora MARIA ROSMERY A. A., es una productora de leche, trabaja en su granja de vacas que son 14, tiene buena producción.Trabaja en la misma hacen 20 años, habiendo crecido bastante.  Es casada, el esposo trabaja la tierra en Santa Cruz, otro departamento.  Ella tiene 4 hijos, tiene 39 años.La tierra es herencia de los padres. 

El crédito està destinado para la compra de soya, que en esta época escasea.  Quiere crecer un poco màs para mejorar sus condiciones de vida que todavía no son de comodidad.
texts.en:
MARIA ROSMERY A. A., 39, is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a farm laborer in Santa Cruz, which is a different department. She inherited her land, on which she has a dairy farm composed of 14 cows, from her parents; production is good. She has had it for 20 years and it has grown considerably. She will use the funds to buy soy, which is scarse this time of year. She would like her business to grow a bit more so that she can improve her living conditions, which aren't yet as comfortable as she'd like them to be.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Amiel

texts.en:
Amiel is 25 years old and single. He lives in Kimironko where he owns a shop in which he sells a variety of goods, including food and some cosmetics. Amiel's shop is open 7:00 AM to 9:00 PM every day.

Amiel is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand his shop in size and in the quantity of goods he sells so that he can satisfy the demands of his customers.

Amiel hopes that after he uses this loan to renovate his shop and add some additional needed goods, he will attract more customers to buy his goods earn more profits as well. He will reinvest some of his profit in his business and save some for his future, as he is close to getting married.

loans.use: Additional goods, such as dishes

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is a 26 years old married lady who has a son and a daughter. Her son is 3 years old and goes to school.  She sells clothes, shoes, handbags and bedding in her shop. She has been running the business for two years and has two employees. She also gets extra income from poultry keeping.  Faulu Kenya has helped her manage the loan she borrows more professionally through business foundation trainings.  She requested for Kes.80,000 so as to add to her stock of clothes.  Vivian hopes to own a world class business in the country and own many exhibitions in the future.  Vivian describes herself as hardworking, committed and visionary.

loans.use: Add stock of clothes

loans.name: Radjabali

texts.ru: Сайфидинов Раджабали проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 33 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Сайфидинов Раджабали имеет собственную торговую точку на рынке. В области торговли работает 5 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Radjabali S. lives in the Vahdat district. He is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. Radjabali has his own retail outlet at a market. He has been working in the retail sales field for 5 years. He is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Marisol Concepcion

texts.es:
Marisol B. de 38 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es taxista con el tiene 2 hijos que estudian es escuelas fiscales.

Marisol empezó vendiendo artículos de cocina a vecinos de su sector, poco a poco tuvo ingresos necesarios para comprar una vitrina y comenzar a vender suministros de papelería.

Ahora Marisol trabaja todos los días en su casa desde las 07h30 hasta las 08h30, vendiendo papelería y en ocasiones también hace trabajos de computadora, uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la iluminación en las noches que es escasa en donde vive.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, hojas, tinta para la impresora y otros suministros para su papelería. En el futuro quiere tener un Cyber con todos los utensilios de papelería.
texts.en:
Marisol B., 38, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil in a cement house that has all basic utilities. Her husband is a taxi driver and they have two children enrolled in public school. Marisol started off selling kitchen articles to her neighbors in thearea. Little by little she earned enough to buy a display case and to stock stationery items. Now, Marisol works every day from 7:30am until 8:30pm selling stationery items; sometimes she does jobs on the computer. One of the obstacles she faces is the lack of street lighting at night in her neighborhood. She will use the funds to buy notebooks, paper, printer ink and other supplies for her stationery store. In the future, she would like to set up an Internet access business stocked with stationery supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, sheets of paper, ink.

loans.name: Sueños De Emprendedores Group

texts.en:
The members of the village bank “Sueños de Emprendedores” (Entrepreneurs’ Dreams) are from Nueva Imperial. Nueva Imperial is located near the city of Temuco, which is the capital of the Araucania region, 670 kilometers (approx. 415 miles) south of Santiago (Chile’s capital). This area has several lakes and a very distinctive flora and fauna. It is also important to note that 50% of this region is of the Mapuche indigenous group, the largest indigenous group in Chile.

This village bank’s members principally work in the following sectors: baking food and selling clothing and bazaar items, which they sell out of their homes and from small shops.

Maria Luisa is the president of “Sueños de Emprendedores” and in the photo above, she is pictured in the second row, dressed in a black, sleeveless dress with one of her hands raised. She works at a bakery, where she makes alfajores (a pastry filled with sweetened, condensed milk), cakes, and puff pastries.  Depending on the time of the year, Maria Luisa also makes pastel de choclo (corn cake, a common Chilean dish) stuffed with potatoes and humitas (made of corn and similar to Mexican tamales).  

Maria Luisa plans to invest this loan in purchasing a flour mill, a blender and a mixer, and she plans to save the rest to put toward an industrial-sized oven. Her dream is to have an established business that provides her with economic stability so that she can dedicate time to herself and her other priorities, such as her children, their studies and her father who is gravely sick.

For Maria Luisa, Kiva's partner Fondo Esperanza has been very important, not only in its financial assistance but in her village bank, because she has had much help from the other members who helped her overcome depression.

loans.use: Flour mill, a blender, a mixer and save the rest for an industial-sized oven

loans.name: Liberathe

texts.en:
Liberathe is 37 years old and married, and he has 8 children, ages 2 to 17. Liberathe and her family live in the Northern Province, approximately two hours from Kigali. This region is touristy, which is appropriate for her business and is the reason why Liberathe has been engaged in business. She has been in business of selling food and a traditional non-alcoholic soft drink that is called "ubushera" in the local language. She has chosen this business because it generates a profit.

Liberathe is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase some additional food to add in her business so she can also start selling it. She will also buy more sorghum to produce the ubushera. If this strategy is successful, she believes she can earn more profits, which will allow her to provide for all of the needs for her children, pay their school fees, and enable her to save money for her future. 

After her business day, Liberathe socializes with her family.

loans.use: To buy food to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Félix A. tiene 52 años y está separado hace más de 15 años, el señor realiza servicio de electricidad, pintura de viviendas hace más de 20 años para la subsistencia de su familia, además en estos últimos años en sus tiempos libres trabaja como moto taxista.

El señor  trabaja en una población rural de Chimore,  a 200 Km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, es una zona bastante alejada de la ciudad, por esta razón es que el Sr. Felix no pudo acudir a otros bancos para obtener un crédito, de esta forma fue que el CIDRE tuvo la iniciativa de brindarle la mano para darle el crédito con el proyecto kiva en beneficio de su familia, ya que el tiene hijos que están en la etapa del estudio

El señor Félix nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es construir su casita con el crédito que obtuvo del CIDRE, en la ciudad de Cochabamba, para darle un techo donde poder vivir a sus hijos, ya que tantos años de trabajo solo fue para su canasta familiar y no pudo tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Félix A., 52, has been separated for 15 years. He has worked as an electrician and house painter for over 20 years to support his family; in the last few years he's also worked as a mototaxi driver. He works in a rural community in Chimore, which is 200 kilometers from Cochabamba; the area is fairly distant from the city. This is why Félix was unable to seek financing from banks and CIDRE had the initiative to help him out with a Kiva loan to benefit his family since he still has school-age children. Félix tells us that his greatest wish is to build a little house in Cochabamba with the CIDRE funds to provide a roof over his children's heads because, in all these years of work, he only earned enough for basic food needs and he was never able to afford his own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home construction.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 44 years old. He is married and has 6 children, ages 4 to 18. He lives with his family in the Northern Province of Rwanda. His village is called Burera, and it is where his food businessis located. This business is profitable for him because it is two hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. This is his fifth successful business. His shop is open from 6:00 AM to 16:00 PM every day except Sunday.

Jean Pierre is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more food, such as beans, sorghum, and Irish potatoes. With this loan, he hopes to earn more profits, which will help him to save money and pay his children's school fees. When Jean Pierre finishes his business each day, he comes home early so he can care for his domestic animals.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Hebert Francisco

texts.es:
Hebert C. E. de 30 años de edad vive en casa de sus padres junto con su conviviente, ellos aún no tiene hijos ya que su idea es obtener primero sus bienes y poder construir un modulo de material noble en el espacio que sus padres le han brindado para darle una estabilidad al niño.
Su domicilio es en la Palma – Cercado de Ica  su trabajo lo realizan diariamente desde las 8.00 am hasta las 2.00pm en el Club del Pueblo pero tambien cuentan con equipo de sonido que lo alquilan eventualmente para ceremonias.
Ellos gozan de buenas referencias desean el financiamiento para poder invertir en su negocio de gaseosas y golosinas ya que se acerca el campeonato Interbarrio y se llevara a cabo en su centro de trabajo ellos tienen muchos sueños se les ve bastante responsabilidad y ganas de seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Hebert C. E. is 30 years old. He lives in his parents' home with his partner; they do not have children yet and their goal is that in order to provide stability for their child they first want to have some assets and be able to build a permanent construction in the spot his parents have provided them. His home is in La Palma, near Ica. He works every day from 8:00 A.M. to 2:00 P.M. in the Club del Pueblo. He also has sound equipment which he rents out for special occasions. They have good references and want this loan in order to invest in their soft drink and candy business now that the inter-city championship is approaching. The championship games will be played at his workplace. They have many dreams and are responsible people who want to be able to progress further.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Victoria Antonieta

texts.es:
Victoria P. de 49 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ya tiene varios años divorciada, no tiene hijos.

Victoria hace años atrás empezó a vender almuerzos a una constructora que había por su casa, poco a poco comenzó a tener ingresos necesarios para poner un pequeño restaurante en su casa.

Ahora victoria trabaja de lunes a viernes sola, cocinando platos como arroz con pollo, carne con puré, ceviches, caldos de carne, pollo, legumbre etc. Tiene un promedio de ganancias diarios de $ 30.00. Una de las dificultades que tiene es el poco espacio que tiene para atender a sus clientes.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, piedras, arena para poder arreglar su casa y tener espacio para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere compra una cocina industrial y poder tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Victoria P., 49, lives in a periurban zone along Guayaquil's beltway in a cement house that has all basic utilities. She has been divorced for several years and has no children. Years ago, Victoria started to sell prepared lunches to employees of a construction company near her house. Gradually, she earned enough to set up a small eatery in her home. Now, Victoria works alone, from Monday through Friday preparing dishes like: rice and beans, meat with mashed potatoes, ceviches, meat broths, chicken, vegetables, etc. Her daily profits average $30.00. One of her obstacles is that she has very little space available for her customers. She will use the funds to buy cement, stone, and sand to build a better space in her house for her eatery. In the future, she would like to buy an industrial stove and to have her own space.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, stone, sand.

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Née en 1970 à Avrankou, commune située à quelques kilomètres de Porto-Novo, D. Célestine est mariée à AGBOENOU Gabriel. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Djassin, dans le troisième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Célestine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et venir en aide à son mari, Célestine vend depuis une dizaine d'année, de la banane et de la patate douce au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo.  Célestine vend également, mais de façon secondaire la farine de manioc (communément appelé gari). Célestine s'approvisionne à Yoko au Bénin. Célestine a obtenu deux fois de crédits à ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Célestine voudrait augmenter son fonds de roulement et agrandir son activité pour mieux attirer la clientèle et réaliser plus de bénéfices. C'est dans cette intention que Célestine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Avrankou, a community located a few kilometers from Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Ms. D. Célestine is married to Mr. AGBOENOU Gabriel. The couple has four children to support, of whom three are their own. Only some of the children are in school. The family lives in the Djassin quarter, in the 3rd district of the city of Porto-Novo. The couple jointly ensures that family expenses are covered. Célestine did not attend school. To meet her needs and to help her husband out, she has been selling bananas and sweet potatoes for ten years at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. She sells cassava flour (commonly called gari) although secondarily. She stocks up in Yoko in Benin. Célestine has twice obtained ALIDé loans and has repaid them both. She would like to increase her working capital and to expand her business, so as to do better in attracting customers and to make more profit. With this in mind, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bunches of bananas and sacks of cassava flour

loans.name: Desarrollo Comuntario 4 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Desarrollo Comunitario (Community Development), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the Samana peninsula, a lush but rugged area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and three children.

Maria is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling pastries by purchasing flour and fruits as well as a large display case to demonstrate her goods. She will use the profits to invest in clothing and food for her children as well as remodeling her house. Additionally, she would like to invest in her business by hiring an employee to help her and by purchasing a vehicle to make deliveries. Her long-term goal is to purchase a plot of land and build her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Flour, fruits and a large display case

loans.name: Jose Heliodoro

texts.es: Don José tiene la edad de 56 años, vive en el barrio 380,  junto a su esposa e hijo, su trabajo es albañil desde hace más de quince años, pues no es fácil ya que es un trabajo agotador, trabajando bajo sol, lo mas dificultoso es cuando terminan una obra y no hay trabajo, pasa hasta una semana para comenzar. Aunque otras veces tiene que viajar a los departamentos hacer trabajo allá. Poco a poco ha ido haciendo mejora a su pequeña casa, pero tiene la necesidad de poner las divisiones del baño y el inodoro ya que no están en las mejores condiciones de higiene,lo cual comprara: bloques, arena y cemento para hacer la division. No lo habia hecho  por que no cuenta con capital ya que lo que gana es para la alimentación y otros gastos. Es por eso con este financiamiento va  a levantar paredes del baño y inodoro y poner puerta. Y gozar de las mejoras que gracia a ala institución será posible.
texts.en:
José, 56, lives in the 380 neighborhood with his wife and son. He has been a bricklayer for over 15 years. This isn't easy work since it is exhausting physically and it's under the relentless sun. The most difficult part of it is not having work once a job is over; sometimes an entire week might go by before starting a new job. Sometimes he even has to travel to other departments to look for work there. Gradually, he has been improving his own small house but he needs to install walls between the bath and toilet because they don't have the best hygienic conditions now. He will buy concrete blocks, sand and cement to build the wall. He hadn't done so before because he lacked the capital to do so because his earnings are barely enough to pay for food and other expenses. Thanks to this help from the institution, he will be able to raise a wall between the bath and toilet and he will install a door and he will be able to enjoy the improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar trabaja como transportista asalariado de trufi (es un taxi asignado a una ruta específica); siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus dos hermanos menores que están estudiando en la universidad pública. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Santiago primero de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una computadora que ayudará en forma muy importante a la formación profesional de sus hermanos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación de préstamo solicitado por Edgar.
texts.en:
Edgar works as a salaried taxi driver, the taxi is assigned to a specific route. This is his main source of income, with which he covers the support of his two younger brothers that are studying in the public university. He lives with his parents in the Santiago zone One of the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy a computer that will greatly help the professional development of his brothers. This is his loan with IMPRO. The evaluation that was performed qualifies Edgar to be approved for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a computer for the education of his brothers that are attending a university.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 27 year old married man with three children.  One child is in school.  His wife is a businesswoman who runs a retail shop selling sodas, maize flour, spices and sweets.  Robert appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping him finance his barber shop and saloon business.  He requested Kes.20,000 to buy a machine for his barber shop and a speaker for his music stall.  He hopes to be self reliant and to expand his business to improve his standards of living.  He describes himself as industrious, responsible and hardworking.

loans.use: Buy a shaving machine and a loud speaker.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Née en 1970, D. Justine réside depuis 17 ans à Djèrègbé Gbokpa, à quelques kilomètres de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Justine est mariée à HOUNNEHEKPON Marcellin, un maçon. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont quatre sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs deux parents à Djèrègbé. Justine vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Justine n'a jamais été à l'école. Il y a un an de cela que Justine a commencé la vente de produits divers (savons de lessive "Klin" et lait "Jago") à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Justine s'approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Justine a obtenu deux fois de crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Justine ambitionne diversifier et élever le niveau de son activité, pour mieux satisfaire la demande des clients. Cependant Justine ne dispose pas des moyens financiers nécessaires pour y parvenir. C'est la raison pour laquelle Justine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1970, D. Justine has resided for seventeen years in Djèrègbé Gbokpa, a few kilometers from Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to HOUNNEHEKPON Marcellin, a mason. The couple has five children to support, of whom four are their own. The children are all in school and live together with their parents in Djèrègbé. Justine helps out her husband where it concerns the different family expenses thanks to the revenues her business brings in. Justine never attended school. A year ago, she started selling various goods (Klin laundry soap and Jago milk) at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She stocks up from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. Justine has twice obtained ALIDé loans, which she has repaid. Her ambition is to diversify her business and to raise its level in order to satisfy customer demand more. However, she lacks the necessary financial means to do so. For these reasons, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying boxes of KLIN soap and boxes of JAGO products

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce del departamento de León, el señor Natividad R. se dedica a su actividad de ganadería donde a diario da lugar a la crianza de estos animales buscando la manera de realizar el engorde y así extraerles el máximo provecho para obtener los ingresos para su familia.
El señor R. es casado y con cuatro hijos que mantener por lo que busca la manera de mejorar sus  condiciones de vida para que su familia salga adelante y a pesar de las dificultades, proyectarse para mejorar. Es por esta razón que ha duplicado sus esfuerzos en la actividad ganadera y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de 3 novillos y 2 vaquillas para la producción de carne y leche para su respectiva comercialización.
texts.en:
In the town of El Sauce in the Department of León, Natividad R. dedicates himself to the raising of livestock. On a daily basis, he looks for ways to fatten the animals in order to maximize his profits and generate income to support his family. Natividad is married with four children. He looks for ways to improve their living conditions so that his family is safe and thrives in spite of difficulties. For this reason he has doubled his livestocking raising efforts. The loan he seeks will be invested in the purchase of three young bulls and two heifers for commercial meat and dairy production.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of young bulls and heifers.

loans.name: Carita De Angel Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “CARITA D. ANGEL” esta ubicado en la Pampa todas son del mismo Barrio, las socias son responsables, es un grupo muy organizado, es su 1º ciclo son personas dedicadas a trabajar para engrandecer su negocio, Rosa  es la Presidenta es una persona muy responsable ella se dedica a la venta D. puertas y ventanas, Karina es la Secretaria, y Josefina es la Tesorera. Todas las socias del Banco Comunal tienen negocio, como ser: Venta D. Comida, Venta D. ropa, Venta D. Cosméticos, Venta D. empanada y joyas. Específicamente cada socia se desempeña en las siguientes actividades: Rosa gloria  como mencionamos anteriormente es la presidenta y venD. puertas desD. hace 8 años atrás, Lusmila se dedica a la venta D. hamburguesa recién desD. hace 1 año, Harry tiene un puesto donD. venD. ropa americana (ropa usada) esto lo hace desD. hace 6 años, Pura leny se dedica a la venta D. joyas plata esto desD. hace 1 año, Maria elena es costurera y su especialidad es la costura D. sabanas desD. hace 2 años, Jorge se dedica a la venta D. pan tiene experiencia en el negocio D. 2 años, Ana consuelo tiene un puesto D. venta donD. ofrece chips D. teléfono celular D. una compañía D. comunicaciones esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 2 años atrás, Irma se dedica a la venta D. comida desD. hace 1 año, Karina es promotora desD. hace 1 año, Josefina se dedica a la carpintería desD. hace 15 años atrás y por último la socia Elsa se dedica a la venta D. dulces y tiene una antigüedad D. 2 años en el negocio. Las socias indican D. que si tienen mucha competencia pero ellas siguen adelante con su trabajo debido al esmero que pone cada una en que su negocio crezca poco a poco. El crédito por lo general lo utilizan para hacer crecer su negocio, aumentar su capital. Y comprar más cosas para el mismo. En su mayoría trabajan con otras Instituciones financieras y nuestra Instrucción pero ellas muestran un antecedente crediticio bueno, además que son responsables con sus pagos.
texts.en:
The communal bank “CARITA D. ANGEL” is located in La Pampa. All the members are from the same neighborhood. They are very responsible and very organized. This is their first application. They are dedicated to working to increase their business. Rosa is the president, she is a very responsible person. She sells doors and windows. Karina is the secretary and Josefina is treasurer. All the members of the communal bank have businesses such as: selling meals, selling clothing, selling cosmetics, selling pastries, and jewelry. Specifically, the various members engage in the following activities: Rosa Gloria, as we mentioned previously, is president and has been selling doors for 8 years; Lusmila has been selling hamburger for one year; Harry has a stall selling used American clothing, which he has done for 6 years; Pura Leny has been selling silver jewelry for 1 year; Maria Elena is a seamstress, her specialty for 2 years has been sewing bedsheets; Jorge has sold bread for 2 years; Ana Consuelo has a stall selling cellular telephone chips, which she has been doing for 2 years; Irma has been selling prepared meals for 1 year; Karina has been a promoter for 1 year; Josefina has been doing carpentry for 15 years; and lastly Elsa has been selling sweets for 2 years. The members state that they have a great deal of talent, but that they get ahead in their work due to the care and dedication given by every member to see their business grow little by little. The loan will be used, in general, to increase their businesses and their business capital, and to buy more things for the business. Most have worked with other financial institutions as well as ours, and they have good credit history and have repaid responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Leonardo Alfredo

texts.es:
Leonardo B. de 42 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa esta en Alemania con ella tiene 2 hijos que estudian en colegios particulares.  

Leonardo empezó trabajando en una empresa de cerrajería, una vez que aprendió esta actividad decidió independizarse y puso un puesto de cerrajería en su casa.  

Ahora Leonardo trabaja todos los días desde las 09h00 hasta las 17h00 elaborando puertas de hierro, ventanas, tiene un empleado que le ayuda. Una de las dificultades que tiene son los racionamientos de energía del gobierno.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar hierro para la elaboración de puertas y cemento, piedras, arena para construir mejor su lugar de trabajo. En el futuro quiere poner otra cerrajería y que su esposa regrese de Alemania.
texts.en:
Leonardo B., 42, lives in the outskirts of the city on Guayaquil's Perimetral highway. His house is made of cement, and it has all of the basic services. His wife is in Germany. They have two children who go to private schools. Leonardo started working in a locksmith shop. Once he learned this job he decided to become independent, and he set up a locksmith stand in his house. Now Leonardo works everyday from 9:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. making doors and windows from iron. He has one employee who helps him. One of the difficulties he has is the government’s rationing of energy. He will use the loan to buy iron to make doors. He will also buy cement, rocks, and sand to better construct his work place. In the future he wants to set up another locksmith shop, and he wants his wife to return from Germany.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Iron, cement, sand, and rocks

loans.name: Ma. Christina

texts.en:
Ma. Christina C.  is a 50-year old married woman who lives in Elona Subdivision Brgy 2, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She earns a living as a manicurist and food vending.

Her husband Joselito also works to support their family.  They have five children who are between eight and 26 years old.  Two children go to school and help their parents operate their business, as part of their daily chores.

Ma. Christina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000.  With the help of loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase her family income by engaging in food vending and by giving manicures. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 5,000.

C. is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 funded her food vending business and it had a positive impact on her business and family. Now she is borrowing her 14th loan, Php 12,000, for her food vending business.  Ma. Christina C.  is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to give them a brighter future and a more comfortable life.
--------------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cola nuts

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny S. is a 45-year old married woman who lives in Brgy Enclaro, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She sells fish. Fanny’s husband Jonathan works as a fisherman and helps her sell the catch. They have seven children who go to school and help their parents as part of their daily chores.

Fanny joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994.  With the help of loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase her family's income by selling fish.  She earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000.

Fanny S. is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 29,000 fund her fish vending business, and it had a positive impact on her business and family.  Now she is borrowing for her 16th loan, the amount of Php 29,000 to continue funding the operations of her fish vending business.  Fanny is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family.
----------------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Silvia Marcela

texts.es: La señora Silvia Marcela H. G., tiene 29 años de edad vive en el Barrio Medardo Andino, vive acomcompañada por su novio y es madre de dos niños pequeños y dentro de sus planes estan la remodelación de su vivienda ella se dedica desde hace 3 años a vender frescos naturales y dentro de sus planes tambien esta la ampliacion del local de venta y la diversificacion de los productos  que ofrece, ella en estos momentos atraviesa por problemas familiares debido a que perdio a su madre quien era la que le apoyaba economicamente y a supervisarle a sus niños mientras estaba en la universidad, tras esto dejo de estudiar para dedicarse a tiempo completo a la venta y a sus hijos, ahora ella solicita este prestamo para comprar materiales de construcción para la ampliacion y compuesta del techado de su casa.
texts.en:
Silvia Marcela H. G., 29, lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. She lives with her boyfriend, and she has two small children. Part of her plan is to remodel her house. For three years she has been selling natural cold drinks. Another part of her plan is to expand her place of sales and to diversify the products she offers. She is now experiencing family problems because she lost her mother. Her mother supported her economically, and she watched the children while Silvia was at the university. Because of this she stopped her studies in order to devote all of her time to selling and to her children. She is asking for this loan to buy construction materials to expand and build the roof on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Diana Lissette

texts.es:
La sra. Diana F. R.  tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad que asiste al colegio de la zona ellos viven en casa de su madre junto con sus hermanas en Acomayo – Ica. 
La sra se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 4 años en el mercado toledo su negocio es diario desde las 5.00 am hasta las 2.00 pm la sra esta separada del padre de su hijo ella cubre todas las necesidades del menor es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora.
 Ella desea que le financiemos un credito para la compra de uva y mango por campaña ya que con eso obtendría un mejor ingreso que le permitira ahorrar para los gastos escolares del presente año su sueño de ella es darle la mejor educación a aus hijo para lograr que el sea profesional.
Se le ve una personas bien responsable que goza de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Diana F. R. has an 8 year old son who attends school in the area where they live. They live in her mother’s home along with her sisters in Acomayo-Ica. She has worked selling vegetables for the last 4 years in the Toledo Market daily from 5:00 am to 2:00 PM. Diana is separated from the child’s father and she takes care of all the necessities of the child. She is a very responsible and hard-working woman. She would like to receive a loan to buy grapes and mangoes in season since they will give her the most profit and allow her to save for this year’s school expenses. Her dream is to give her child the best education so that he becomes a professional. Her neighbors give her high marks as being a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: H. Hélène est née en 1975 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Hélène vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Houinmè dans le quatrième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. Mariée à ALI Nassirou un chauffeur, Hélène est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Hélène vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure les charges de la famille. Hélène a très peu fréquenté. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Hélène vend divers produits (couscous, pâtes alimentaires, lait, sucre, papier hygiénique, sardines, amuse gueule, riz, etc.) à son domicile. Hélène vend également des produits de cheveux (mèches, pommades, défrisants, huile pour cheveux, etc.), ce qui lui permet d'avoir plusieurs sources de revenus. C'est au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, et à Kétou, dans le département du Plateau au Bénin, que Hélène se ravitaille. Hélène a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Hélène n’arrive plus à bien répondre à la demande de tous ses clients. En vue de renforcer son capital et d’élever le niveau de son activité, pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, Hélène sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Hélène was born in 1975 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She has been living for ten years in the Houinmè quarter, in the 4th district of Porto-Novo. Married to ALI Nassirou, a chauffeur, she is the mother of two children who are both in school. She lives together with her children and husband. The couple ensures that family expenses are covered. Hélène had very little schooling. To meet her different responsibilities, she sells a variety of goods (couscous, pasta, milk, sugar, toilet paper, sardines, tasty snacks, rice, etc.) out of her home. She also sells hair products, such as hair extensions, ointments, straighteners, hair oils, etc. This allows her to have several sources of revenues. She stocks up on supplies at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo, and in Kétou, in Plateau county, Benin. Hélène once obtained an ALIDé loan, which she has repaid. She is no longer able respond well to the demands of all her customers. With regard to boosting her capital and raising her level of business, so as to satisfy her customers more, Hélène is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various goods (sardines, pasta, sugar, couscous, rice, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Marlene Antonia

texts.es: Marlene Antonia tiene 48 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de cerdos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que fue una necesidad primordial ya que tenía que alimentar a sus 2 hijos, por lo que no tenia ingresos suficientes para salir adelante. Por lo que decide iniciar a este negocio, porque fue por la ayuda de una amiga que le ayudo con este negocio, ya que en su comarca se volvió muy popular con este negocio. Ella solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos.  Su deseo es proporcionarles estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marlene Antonia is 48 years old and is a very hard-working and responsible woman. She makes a living buying and selling pigs and has been dedicated to this business for more than five years. She started because it was an absolute necessity to feed her two children and she didn't have sufficient funds to make headway. So she decided to start this work and did it with the help of a friend because this kind of business has become very popular in her region. Marlene is requesting working capital to purchase pigs, and her wish is to provide for her children's studies.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Brenda Cristina

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora Brenda G. se ha dedicado con mucho entusiasmo a atender su negocio de venta de comida la que es comercializada en su propio local donde cuenta con varias sillas y mesas para que los clientes disfruten ya sea de un buen desayuno, almuerzo o cena.

Ella está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima como lo es la carne de pollo y otros productos para la comida y de esta manera beneficiar a sus clientes con sus riquísimos platillos elaborados por ella misma.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market in Managua, Brenda G. has dedicated herself with much enthusiasm to attending her business selling food from her own restaurant which has many seats and tables where customers can enjoy a good breakfast, lunch or dinner. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as chicken and other food products and, in this manner, provide benefit to her customers with her delicious dishes made by her.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicken and other ingredients to make dishes.

loans.name: Juana Vilma

texts.es: Juana Vilma tiene 54 años, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 por lo que su record crediticio es muy bueno.  Es una madre soltera  y tiene 4 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica de Doña Juana es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. Los problemas que ha enfrentado Juana son de salud ya que debido a su edad es muy difícil tener la agilidad para servir a sus clientes, pero esto no le impide el seguir adelante. Pero por siempre se ha caracterizado por tener un gran carisma con sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de pinturas de uñas, colonias, ropa interior, pantalones entre otros producto. Su deseo es que su salud mejore para continuar con este negocio.
texts.en:
Juana Vilma is 54 years old and has worked with Kiva partner Fundación León 2000 for a long time and has a very good credit history. She is a single mother of four children and works independently. She makes a living selling general supplies and has been dedicated to this activity for more than seven years. Juana has confronted health problems because of her age, which makes it difficult to serve her customers, but this has not stopped her from making headway. She has always been known for having a great charisma with her customers. She plans to use the loan for working capital to purchase nail polish, cologne, undergarments, pants and other products. Her wish is for her health to improve so she can continue this business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase supplies

loans.name: Fenena

texts.en:
Fenena A.  is a 57-year old married woman who lives in Brgy Galecia, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling fish, vegetables and spices.

Fenena’s husband Roberto helps run the business. They have 6 adult age children.  Some of them work and help support the family.  Fenena and her husband Roberto want to save enough to provide for themselves when they are too old to continue working for their own living.

Fenena A. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994.  With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by selling fish, vegetables and spices. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 45,000.

Fenena is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 29,500 was used to operate her fish, vegetables and spice business, and it had a positive impact on her business and the family.  Now she is borrowing her 13th loan, the amount of Php 50,000 to stock up on bigger volumes of fish, vegetable and spices to sell for higher profita.  Fenena is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.
----------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Buy fish, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: M. Laurence

texts.fr: Née en 1961, H. M. Laurence vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Tokpota à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Laurence est divorcée de son mari, et est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Laurence vit seule et supporte seule ses charges. Laurence a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Suite à son échec, Laurence a commencé par vendre des produits vivriers (maïs, riz, haricot, etc.), une activité qu'elle mène passionnément depuis une quinzaine d'année et qui lui permet de faire face à ses différents besoins. C'est à Ikpinlè, un marché de vente de produits vivriers au Bénin que Laurence se ravitaille. Mais Laurence vend ses produits à Porto-Novo. Laurence a bénéficié une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Actuellement, Laurence éprouve des difficultés financières pour s'approvisionner et augmenter le stock de ses produits. C'est dans cette optique, et pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, que Laurence sollicite un deuxième pêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1961, Laurence H. has been living for 10 years in the Tokpota neighbourhood of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Laurence is divorced from her husband and has a school-age child. Laurence lives alone and is solely responsible for the household expenses. Laurence attended school up until High School. When she failed her school year, Laurence began selling foodstuffs (maize, rice, beans, etc.) and has been doing so with great energy for roughly 15 years; this allows her to meet her various needs. Laurence buys her goods at the Ikpinlè food market of Benin, but sells them in Porto-Novo. Laurence has had a prior loan with Alidé which was repaid in full. Laurence is currently experiencing financial difficulties to purchase and increase her inventory. Because of this, and in order to better satisfy her customers, Laurence is asking for this, her second loan.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and maize.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 50 years old and married, and he has two children, ages 13 and 16, both of whom are in school. He lives in the Musanze district in the Northern Province of Rwanda, where his business is located. It is the volcano region. 

David has someone of his families who works as driver, but he has chosen to be a businessman. He owns his small grocery store which is famous in this region despite his small investment. He works hard to satisfy his customers by purchasing more products and selling them at good price to attract customers. David starts his daily activity and 6:00 AM and works until to 6:00 PM every day except Sunday.

David is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more products, such as soda and biscuits. With these additional products, David will be able to attract more customers and offer them different kinds of products of good quality. In turn, this will help him to earn more profits. With these profits, David hopes to change his family's life by feeding them good quality food, paying the school fees for his children and saving money for a secure future.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José V. R., tiene la edad de 40 años, es casado, y tiene 3 hijos. Los hijos tienen 2,6 y 10 años de edad respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de terneros para la cría y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. Esta inversión le va ayudar a aumentar la cantidad y calidad del ganado y al mismo tiempo tener mayor ganancia. Es la primera vez que don José  se financea con  FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho, además que está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, además de crecer como productor y como persona.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living
texts.en:
José V. R. is 40 years old, married and has three children, ages 2, 6 and 10. With the loan he is requesting, he plans to purchase calves to raise and then sell for a profit when they are fully grown. This investment will help him increase the quantity and quality of his cattle and at the same time improve his income. This is the first time José has been financed by Kiva partner FUDECOSUR, and he says that the credit committee has greatly helped him and that he is very pleased with the facilities they provide. He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and more economic stability as well as grow as a producer and a person. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 30 years old and unmarried. He completed primary school and passed the exam to attend intermediate school.

The borrower owns a restaurant. He will use this loan to expand his restaurant and purchase a grilling machine, refrigerator, freezer, and food for his restaurant. 

He offers good service, a neat and clean place to eat, and all of the services that his customers require, thereby, gaining more customers. He has been able to enlarge his shop and hire more waiters to serve the clients. 

He has a good reputation among his colleagues in the market and is pleasant to his customers. This attracts many clients who decide to have their meals there. He serves a three-course meal every day.

loans.use: To buy a grilling machine, refrigerator, freezer, and food for his restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes and bags

loans.name: Oldemar

texts.es:
Oldemar U. F., tiene la edad de 22 años, es soltero. Vive con sus padres y seis hermanos. El crédito lo quiere para la cría de gallinas ponedoras y pollos de engorde.También, desea construir los encierros para las gallinas y otros arreglos a la granja. Con esta inversión el espera crecer en su negocio y poder aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su situación económica. Es la primera vez que don oldemar se financia con FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y que le brindaron muchas facilidades a la hora de solicitar el crédito. 
El espera que con este proyecto poder fortalecer su negocio aumentando la producción y aumentando las ventas, para así ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica.
