Julia Candelaria T. Vásquez is 34 years old and married. She has a business selling French fries, with her own sales cart. She lives with her husband and 4 children. She and her husband work together and have an employee to help them. For the past 13 years, they have worked in this business, which is located in Paraje Paquechop, in the canton of Xesacmaljá, Department of Totonicapán, Guatemala, Currently, the demand from her customers has been rising, but the current economic conditions have not been favorable enough to allow her to increase her capital. For this reason, she came to the ASDIR Association to request a loan, with the aim of purchasing supplies, and thus increasing her sales, while hoping also to help her children get ahead and provide them with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing supplies

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu S. sells African textiles (lace and cotton) and local food, such as groundnuts and garri, a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava (manioc). She is married and rents a shop at a shopping centre called Roma Market. She has spent 15 years of her life in trading (selling goods). Her husband is also a trader.

She has 15 dependants, including her three children, who are in primary school. She normally goes to Guinea to sell to sell her food and, on the way back,  she buys African textiles to sell in her shop.

Isatu is seeking a loan to cope with the high foreign exchange rate so that she can increase her inventory and meet her customer's demands. She hopes to use the proceeds of this loan to feed and pay the school fees of her children and dependents.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing material

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina T. is from the village of Migpange Bonifacio. She is 44 years old. Marina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marina owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, candies, some food for snacks, sugar, salt, noodles, coffee, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Marina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Marina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Marina is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and engage to other business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions and pay her children's tuition.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio P. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 46 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Leoncio owns and operates a business providing motorcycle shop services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Leoncio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Leoncio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for his business. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for his business

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta C. is from the village of D' Fernan Bonifacio. She is 41 years old. Marieta is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marieta owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, some food for snacks, sugar, soap & toothpaste and other daily use products in the local community. Marieta has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Marieta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Marieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Theressa

texts.en:
Theressa R. is from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 29 years old. Theressa is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Theressa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting cassava for sale. Theressa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Theressa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Theressa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Theressa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her child and save for future needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen T. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Carmen is widowed and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Carmen owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle repair shop services to local community members. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Carmen is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her business. This will be the second loan taken out by Carmen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza E. is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 48 years old. Flordeliza is separated from her spouse and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Flordeliza owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, sugar, canned goods (sardines) & toothpaste in the local community. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Flordeliza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Flordeliza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maristelle

texts.en:
Maristelle A. is from the village of Curvada in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 29 years old. Maristelle is married and has 2 young children. To make a living, Maristelle owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells sugar, coffee, toothpaste, biscuits and candies in the local community. Maristelle has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maristelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maristelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Maristelle is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Maristelle's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Axiel De Fatima

texts.es:
La  señora Axiel M. C., Labora como Secretaria Ejecutiva en el área de docencia del Centro de Capacitación Nicaragüense.
 
 Ella  tiene  dos hijo a su cargo, y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, está casada, ha trabajado cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita y este ultimo para gastos de colegio, gracias al los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en los gastos de colegio para su hijo.
texts.en:
Ms. Axiel M. C. is an executive secretary at CECNA, the Nicaraguan-German Professional Training Center. She is married and has a son under her care, who is still of school age. She has had four loans with CEPRODEL in four years. She invested the first three loans in home improvement and the last one was used to pay for school expenses. She is thankful for loans granted by CEPRODEL. She will use the requested funds to pay for her son's school expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay school costs.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth V. is from the village of San Vicente in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Lilibeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, candies, soap (bath and laundry), and toothpaste in the local community. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lilibeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Lilibeth's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Este cliente tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este esta en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado un créditos con CEPRODEL durante un años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y ladrillos, para su casa de habitación por lo que esta no tenía.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

El dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ahora cuenta con una vivienda más segura.
texts.en:
This client is married and has a school-aged son under his care. He has had one loan with CEPRODEL during the year which, thanks to the financing from CEPRODEL, he made some home improvements . He is asking for funding to buy building materials like, cement, sand and bricks for his home, because it doesn't have any. His goal is to have better security and living conditions for his children. He said he now has a safer home thanks to the loans from CEPRODEL, which have been of great help to him.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair and enlarge his home.

loans.name: Emerilyn's Group

texts.en:
Emerilyn F. is from the village of Upper Langcangan in Oroquieta City. She is 53 years old. Emerilyn is the leader of a 2-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Emerilyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Emerilyn sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Emerilyn is just starting this business.

In 2010, Emerilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emerilyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used capital for her sari-sari (variety) store. This will be Emerilyn's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Anecita's Group

texts.en:
Anecita P. is from the village of Tungawan Tambulig ZDS. She is 33 years old. Anecita is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Anecita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Anecita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as biscuits, candies, shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other daily use products in the local community. Anecita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $116 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Anecita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fidel Ernesto

texts.es:
El Señor Fidel Ernesto B. C., Labora como vigilante en el Mercado Israel Lewites de Managua, el tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este esta en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y un inodoro, para la construcción de un baño en su casa de habitación, ya que este se encuentra en mal estado.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

 dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ahora cuenta con una vivienda más segura.
texts.en:
Fidel Ernesto B. C. works as a watchman at Managua's Israel Lewites market. He is married and has a school-age child under his care. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL during two years. In this time, he used two loans to make home improvements to his house, thanks to the financing from CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client. The financing requested now is to buy building materils like cement, sand and a toilet to build a bathroom in his house because the one it has is in poor condition. His goal is to provide better security and living conditions for his children. He stated that CEPRODEL loans have allowed him to have a safer home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge and make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Zaida Ligia

texts.es:
Doña Zaida Pérez tiene su propio negocio en San Juan de Oriente, se dedica a  la elaboración de artesanías en barro, como por ejemplo ollas grandes y pequeñas, ánforas, juegos de vajillas, etc. El crédito que solicito lo utilizo para la inversión del mismo para incrementar sus ventas y así tener una mayor ganancia esto con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Ella ponía sus artesanías donde su hermano ahora ella cuenta con su propio establecimiento que a la vez es su casa de habitación, desde pequeña su papa le enseño a elaborar esas artesanías y ahora ella que ha innovado otros estilos, sus clientes son de Costa Rica, San Salvador, Y Holanda, tiene una hija de seis años, ha tenido tres créditos con CEPRODEL los cuales le han ayudado para ahora tener su propia casa, y por ende su propio establecimiento.
texts.en:
Zaida Pérez has her own clay crafts-making business in San Juan de Oriente. She makes large and small pots, vases, dinnerware, etc. She used the requested funds to invest in her business in order to increase sales and thus clear higher profits with the goal in mind to improve her quality of life. She used to sell her crafts in her brother's place but now she has her own place, which is also her home. She learned how to make these crafts from her father when she was still a little girl. Now, she has designed other styles. She has customers in Costa Rica, San Salvador and Holland. She has a 6-year-old daughter. She has had three loans with CEPRODEL, which have helped her acquire her own home and thus her own place to sell her wares.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy special paint for ceramics.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz L. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 43 years old and she is married. To make a living, Luz owns and operates a specialized retail store selling clothing products in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $200 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Luz joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Luz is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. is from the village of Solinog Clamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Jocelyn is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jocelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising pigs to sell. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $230 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La  Señora Maritza Gutiérrez Martínez, Labora como Aseador en la Unidad de Intendencia en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.
 
 Ella  tiene  un hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en materiales de construcción como, piedra y cemento para embaldosar el frente de su casa de habitación, ya que esta es de tierra y el polvo dentro de la casa y esto perjudica la salud de sus hijos.

Maritza dijo que gracias a los financiamientos ha podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
. Maritza Gutiérrez Martínez works as a cleaning lady in the maintenance department of the Nicaragua National Autonomous University. She is married and has a school-age child under her care. She has had three loans with CEPODEL during two years. Thanks to these loans from CEPRODEL, she invested the three loans in home improvements The loan requested now will be used to buy building materials like stone and cement to tile the front of the house, which is currently dirt and the dust inside the house is a health hazard for her children. Maritza said that she has been able to improve her house thanks to the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge and make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Nidia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La  señora Nidia M. labora como secretaria en uno de los mercados de Managua.
 
Ella  tiene  un hijo a su cargo el cual se encuentra en edad escolar y ella busca la manera de cómo brindarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.

Actualmente está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que así se requiere. Ella comprará  5 láminas de zinc y otros materiales para llevar a cabo esta obra y así beneficiar a su hijo que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Nidia M. M. works as a secretary for the administrators of the Israel Lewites Market in Managua. She has one child that is of school age and is looking to provide the best conditions necessary for his development. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to invest in construction materials, such as 5 sheets of zinc for her home's kitchen, which is currently in poor condition. Nidia reports that thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to improve the home in which she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving and expanding her home

loans.name: Ervin Antonio

texts.es:
El  Señor. Ervin Antonio G. M., Labora PARA CEPRODEL COMO GUARDA DE SEGURIDAD, el tiene tres hijos a su cargo  y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, es ajuntado, ha trabajado veinte  créditos con CEPRODEL durante quince años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cinco créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines para el techo de su casa.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ervin Antonio G. M. works as a security guard for CEPRODEL. He lives with his life partner and has three, school-age children under his care. Over the last 15 years he has had 20 loans with CEPRODEL that he has used to make home improvements. He is an excellent client. The requested financing is to buy building materials like zinc metal sheeting and metal joints for his house's roof. His goal is to offer his children enhanced security and better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge and make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Mayra Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra G. M., Labora PARA INFARSA COMO AFANADORA, ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo  y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado cinco créditos con CEPRODEL durante seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cinco créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y clavos para el techo de su casa.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mayra G. M. works as a cleaning lady for INFARSA (a pharmaceutical company). She is married and has two, school-age children under her care. She has had 5 loans with CEPRODEL during 6 years. She used the five loans to make improvements to her home. She is an excellent client. She needs funding to buy building materials like zinc metal sheeting and nails for her house's roof. Her goal is to offer her children better security and improved quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make home improvements.

loans.name: Norm

texts.en: Mrs. Norm C. is 51 years old, and she lives in Tonle village in Takeo province.   She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice on to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sumbat Moung, is a palm juice collector. This family has a problem because her husband can obtain a lot of palm juice, so he must sell palm juice far from his village, but he does not have a motorbike to transport it to sell. Thus, Mrs. Norm C. decided to request a loan to buy a new motorbike for their palm juice business to increase income. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other is enrolled in a local public school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for their palm juice business

loans.name: Maribel Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Maribel del Socorro E., Labora  Para la Lotería Nacional como: Técnica de Recursos Humanos, ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo, una de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 3 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, Hierro y piedra la construcción de un baño.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maribel del Socorro E. works for the National Lottery as a Human Resources Technician. She is a single mother and has two children in her care, one of them of school age. She has had three previous loans with CEPRODEL during the past four years. During this time, she has invested funds from the three loans in improving the home in which she lives, thanks to the financing provided by CEPRODEL, and she has been an excellent client. She is currently requesting a loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, iron and stone to build a bathroom. Her aim is to provide her children with improved safety and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving and expanding her home

loans.name: Rodolfo Jose

texts.es:
El  señor Rodolfo José Jarquín López, labora en un hospital de Managua, es muy trabajador y siempre se ha preocupado por llevar el sustento a su hogar compuesto por sus padres.

Ha tomado la decisión de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para briandarle un techo digno a sus padres y es por este motivo que solicita un crédito para la compra de zinc y perlines para así contribuir al mejoramiento de la vivinda.
texts.en:
Rodolfo José J. López works in a hospital in Managua, he is a very hard worker and is always very concerned about sustaining proper living conditions for his parents. He has decided to improve the conditions of their house and build a proper roof for them. With this loan he plans to buy zinc and timber to build the roof and in this manner contribute to the improvement of his parents home.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: housing improvement and addition

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phun K. is 57 years old, and raises pigs. Her husband, Mr. Siym Soun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice to support their family living. This couple lives in Smaong Village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Phun K. has some problem because her pigs are too small to sell, yet she does not have the money to support them. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig feed. The rest of the loan she would use to buy more piglets to raise.

Mrs. Phun K. is the mother of five children, two of whom are farmers while the others are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and more piglets

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap N. is a villager in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is 37 years old and is a farmer, owning a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family living.

Mrs. Sopheap N. has a problem because it’s the time to plow her rice field but she did not plow it because she does not have oxen to plow it with. Moreover, she does not have enough money to pay someone else to plow it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to use to plow her field.

Mrs. Sopheap N.’s husband, Mr. ChabThouk Nuon, is a teacher in the local school who earns less income than needed to support their family. This couple has three children, one of whom works in the public sector while the others are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to plow her rice field with

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: La señora tiene negocio de ventas varias, el crédito lo invertirá para incrementar su capital de trabajo y así poder tener un mejor ganancia para poder mejorar su calidad de vida para su familia, ella ha tenido dos crédito con CEPRODEL de los cuales les ha beneficiado en grande ya que ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos es madre de dos niños en edad escolar, ella desde muy temprano esta en pie en su negocio y cerrándolo a horas muy tarde, esto lo hace por su familia.
texts.en:
She has a general store. She will use the funds to buy stock items so that her profits will be higher and thus be able to provide a better quality of life for her children. She has had two loans with CEPRODEL which have been of great benefit to her because they have allowed her to get her two, school-age children, ahead. She rises very early in the morning to tend to her business and closes very late at night; she does this for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, beer, soft-drinks.

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mrs. Thach R. is 38 years old and she lives in Smaong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeun Chhun, is a duck breeder who is able to raise six hundred ducks yearly as additional income to support their family living. He is shown on the right in the photo.

However hard this family tries to work with their businesses, they still earn less income than needed to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Thach R. decided to request a loan to buy one tonne (1,000 Kg) of rice and duck vaccine for her husband’s duck business.

This couple has three children, one of whom is employed in the local public school while the others are attending the school.

loans.use: To buy one tonne of rice and duck vaccine for her husband's duck business

loans.name: Yay

texts.en: Yay S. is 42 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been buying rice from the growers and reselling it to the market wholesale to earn a profit of about $3 of profit each day. Her husband is a truck driver who is able to make $3 per day as well. This couple has three school-aged children. Yay S. is asking for a loan of $1000 to increase her stock of rice.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Teodora Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Teodora tiene el negocio de elaboración de calzado, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para el mismo, ella ha trabajado mas de dos años con CEPRODEL de los cuales los créditos le ha beneficiado grandemente ya que ha podido mejorar el local donde tiene el taller y también ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, ella tiene clientes fuera de Nicaragua los cuales viajan a honduras, y también en el sector donde habita esto le dado el beneficio de incrementar sus ventas y así tener mayores ingresos es madre de tres hijo, dos de ellos ya son independientes y uno de 14 años que esta estudiando.
texts.en:
Teodora is a shoemaker. She will use the funds to buy materials and supplies for her shop. She has collaborated with CEPRODEL for over two years and, during that time, the loans have been of great benefit to her because she has been able to make improvements to the locale where she has her workshop and also have helped her get her family ahead in life. She has customers outside of Nicaragua, who travel to Honduras, and also from her own neighborhood. This has allowed her to increase her sales and have higher income. She has three children, two of whom are already independent and one, who is 14 years old, who is still a student.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy high and low soles.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin L., 44, is married and lives with her three children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than $1 each day, while her husband, pictured here, works as a moto-taxi driver making $5 each day. Yin L. would like to take out a loan of $1000. Her husband needs to purchase a motorbike to operate as a moto-taxi.

loans.use: To buy a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Ne

texts.en:
Mrs. Ne N. is a villager in Smaong village in Takeo province; she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Seoun Soung, is a duck breeder who also earns some money to support their family.  This couple has four children, two of whom attend a local public school, while the others are too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

This family has a problem because while they have lot of ducklings, they do not have enough money to feed them. Thus, Mrs. Ne N. decided to apply a loan to buy 1.5 tons of rice to make duck food.

loans.use: To buy 1.5 tons of rice to make duck food

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S., 29, lives in the Takeo province with her husband and one young child. She is a silk scarf weaver who is able to make about $2 each day, while her husband is a garment factory worker and makes $2 a day as well. To earn more money, Sok S. is asking for a loan of $900 to purchase silk and other materials for weaving more scarves.

loans.use: To purchase silk and other materials for weaving scarves.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Mrs. Chin S. is 56 years old, and she lives in Smaong village in Takeo province. She is a widow with three children; one is a laborer at a garment factory, while the others are studying at a local public school. 

Mrs. Chin S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to support her family by cultivating rice, and she also is a Khmer cake maker.  While her family tries to work hard, they do not earn enough income.  She wants to start a new duck breeding business, but does not have enough money. 

Thus, Mrs. Chin S. decided to request a loan to buy 1000 ducks, and will use the rest of the loan to buy one ton of rice to make duck food.

loans.use: To buy 1000 ducks and one ton of rice to make duck food

loans.name: Thuok

texts.en:
Thuok Narnn is 45 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a rice farmer and she also sells flowers at the local market. She is able to make about $2 of profit every day. 

Her husband has been operating a moto-taxi since 2000. On average, he is able to make about $5 a day. This couple has five children, three of whom are garment factory workers and one is a student. 

Thuok Narnn is requesting a loan of $1200 to make two investments. She would like to reinvest $200 in her flower business and the rest is to invest in a fruit store.

loans.use: Invest in a fruit store and reinvest in flower business.

loans.name: Lav

texts.en:
Mrs. Lav L. is a 62-year-old villager in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice, and she also raises chickens to support her family. She is a widow with a child who is employed at a garment factory. 

Her family has a problem because the garment factory is too far from their home. Thus, Mrs. Lav L. decided to ask a loan to buy a new motorbike for transportation to the garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
Mrs. Nak R. lives in Tonle village in Takeo province, and she is 58 years old. She is the mother of six children; one works in the public sector, one is employed at a garment factory, and the others attend a local public school.  

She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice.  Her husband, Mr. Hak Heam, earns money to support their family by collecting palm juice. He is on the left in the picture.

This year, Mr. Hak Heam can harvest juice from more palm trees than last year.  However, he must sell it far from the local village, and he does not have any way to transport the palm juice.  Mrs. Nak R. decided to ask a loan to buy a new motorbike for him to use as transportation.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for transporting palm juice

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Doña Maria T. solicito el crédito para uso personal específicamente para compras de útiles escolares y uniformes ella es profesora de primaria,  tiene de trabajar con CEPRODEL ya casi dos años y medio, ella vive en Masaya en un barrio llamado pancasan, tiene dos hijos que están en edad escolar y prácticamente ella con su salario y el préstamo compra todo lo necesario para que tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
Maria T. is requesting a loan for personal use, specifically to purchase school supplies and uniforms. She is an elementary school teacher and has been involved with CEPRODEL for nearly two and a half years. She lives in Masaya in a neighborhood called Pancasan. She has two children who are of school age, and with her salary and the loan, she will be able to buy them everything they need to get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing school supplies

loans.name: Dim

texts.en:
Dim L. is 30 years old and resides with her husband in the Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been working as a garment factory worker and is able to make about $1.60 every day. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver. On average, he makes $5.60 a day. This couple has two young children living at home to support. 

Dim's husband is complaining about his old motorbike. He says that it takes a lot of gas to operate and that he often has to take the bike in for repairs. Recognizing these difficulties, Dim L. is asking for a loan of $800 so that her husband can replace his old and unreliable motorbike.

loans.use: To replace an old and unreliable motorbike.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn T. is a 37-year-old villager in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is the mother of three children; two attend a local public school, while one helps her do housework. 

Mrs. Phorn T. is a farmer who owns two hectares of land to cultivate rice, and is also a Khmer cake maker to support her family. She has some problems with her rice field because the soil is infertile. Thus, Mrs. Phorn T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers.  With the rest of the loan she will buy rice seeds, pesticides, fuel, and hire a laborer to plow the field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for a rice field

loans.name: Consorcia's Group

texts.en: Consorcia G.'s main source of income comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. She is 47 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from Barangay Sto. Nino, Pagadian City. Consorcia has been in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Consorcia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Consorcia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. Consorcia is the leader of a 4 member group accessing a loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Vong N. is a 41-year-old and sells vegetables at the local market in Takeo province. She has been operating this business since 2005 and is able to make about $6.60 of profit a day. Her husband has a business transporting fish from the fishermen to resell and distribute to small fish-sellers at the market. On average, he earns $3.30 a day. This couple has three children, two of whom are in school and one is a garment factory worker. 

Vong N. has an idea to invest in a new business in order to increase her daily income. She would like to sell fish as an extra business. In doing this, she expects to have more profit to help raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To invest in a fish-selling business.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Mrs. Phally T. is a villager in Melong Khang Cheung village in Takeo province. She is a 22-year-old farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Hieng Mach, is a duck breeder who earns a small income from selling eggs to support their family. However hard this family tries to work, they can only earn a little income because her husband can only keep a few ducks. Thus, Mrs.Phally T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for her husband. This couple has no children. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria R. is 54 years old and is a fish vendor. She sells fish daily in her village to raise money for buying food, clothing and other basic needs for her family. She started her fish-selling business in 1972. 

She would like to grow her business more. With a small loan from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc., she will be helped in realizing her dreams. She will be able to obtain more fish to re-sell and earn a better income.

loans.use: Obtain more fish to re-sell

loans.name: Adelo

texts.en:
In 2006, Adelo Mendoc started selling fish in his village. He works everyday to earn an income for his family. He desires to have a simple life and an abundant supply of food and clothes for his children.

Because he wants to grow his business more, Adelo needs additional capitalization for his business. He would like to apply for a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to obtain more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Rodgimar

texts.en:
Rodgimar A., 25 years old, told CEVI that he is engaged in multi-business. Aside from seaweed, he also sells fish and seashells in his village.

Rodgimar was not able to go to school because of financial difficulty in his family and that is why he toils so hard in his seaweed business to be able to earn income and save money for the future.

Rodgimar would like to grow his business more. He hopes to receive a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy seaweed seedlings for his seaweed farm and fish that he resells in the market.

loans.use: To buy seaweed seedlings for his seaweed farm and more fish to sell

loans.name: Diego

texts.en: 39-year-old Diego T. is a fisherman and at the same time a fish vendor in Talibon Bohol. He said that his only dream is to be able to fulfill his obligation in sending his children to school. He wants them to be professionals someday so that they will be able to find good employment when they are older. He is seeks a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the proceeds of this loan to buy more fish to resell, and fishing supplies.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to resell at market, and fishing supplies.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites started managing her sari-sari (variety) store in 2008.  Now with all her efforts to make it bigger, she has been able to better provide for the financial needs of her family.  She is 40 years old living in Norala, South Cotabato.

Marites plans to use this 12,000 Philippine peso loan from Kiva field partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy groceries for her store and make it more productive.

loans.use: groceries

loans.name: Semfronia

texts.en:
Semfronia A. is from the city of Sto.Nino, Pagadian City. She is 50 years old. Semfronia is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Semfronia owns and operates a general store. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Semfronia has managed her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Semfronia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Semfronia from PMPC. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Semfronia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory, and for working capital.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for a general store

loans.name: Larch

texts.en: Larch K. is a 51-year-old and lives with two of her children and her husband in Takeo Province. She is a rice farmer and also raises animals to earn a living and is able to make about U.S. $1 of profit a day. Currently, her husband is a truck driver.  He usually transports cement and construction materials from building material supply shops to construction sites. Larch K. is asking for a loan of US$1,200 in order to help her husband purchase a work truck to transport construction materials. (Larch K. was not available for picture so her husband is picture instead)

loans.use: To purchase a truck.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida D. is from the village of Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 42 years old. Leonida is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling a variety of beauty products in the local community. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately $114 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Leonida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Cecelia's Group

texts.en:
Cecelia C. is from the city of Danlugan, Pagadian City. She is 59 years old. Cecelia is the group leader of a two-member loan group with PMPC. While each member of the group receives individual loans, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

To make a living, Cecelia owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Cecelia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Cecelia from PMPC; she has successfully repaid previous loans.

Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, for growing vegetables

loans.name: Mrs. Roem Chhieng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Roem C. is 47 years old, and the mother of three children who are students at the local school.  Her husband, Mr. Yom Yeng, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is the village bank president for a group of 12 people. They live in Chumrov village in Tekeo province and will be using this loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Roem C. is a silk weaver who wants to expand her business to support her family. Thus, she decided to ask a loan to buy more silks for weaving.

loans.use: To buy more silks for weaving

loans.name: Melita's Group

texts.en: Melita S. owns and operates a fruit and vegetable vending business. She is 38 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Cabisera 9-11, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela. Melita has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Melita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Melita has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI which was used to purchase products to sell. Melita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Melita is the leader of a 4 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Melita S. Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel D. P. is from the village of Barangay 4, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old. Razel is married and has five school-aged children. 

To make a living, Razel owns and manages a mini-grocery store located in the public market of Balingasag. At the same time she is also engaged in buying and selling ready-to-wear items for all ages, like dresses, shirts, pants and more. She sells these items in the local community. 

Razel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $260 a month from these activities. (Shown in the photo are newly purchased goods intended for selling.)

In 2009, Razel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Razel is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from the village of Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 40 years old and she is married. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $75 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mrs. Phally Eang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally E. is a 43-year-old silk weaver. Her husband, Mr. Dy Cheng, is a driver who owns a truck for transportation. Mrs. Phally E. is the mother of four children: one is employed in a garment factory, another is a driver, while the others are students in the local school. 

In order to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Phally E. decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. She is the village bank president for this group of 15 people located in Chumrov village in Takeo province.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Unn

texts.en:
Unn P., 49, is married and lives with six of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about $1 each day and are supported by one child who works in the garment factory. 

This couple also works at collecting palm juice to sell in the community. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into creating a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Unn P. included. 

In light of these economic difficulties, Unn is asking for a loan of $650 to make a new investment. She would like to raise cows from calves and then sell them. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: to raise calves

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion G. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 46 years old, married and has five adult children. She is from the village of Centro 2, Mallig, Isabela. Concepcion has been in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Concepcion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her eighth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar G. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. He is 34 years old. Cesar is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Cesar owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Cesar has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Cesar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Cesar is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Rolie

texts.en:
Rolie Z., from the village of Kinuguitan, Misamis Oriental, is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rolie owns and operates a specialized retail store whose main revenue comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Rolie has been engaged in his business for over three years, earning approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rolie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Esmenia's Group

texts.en:
Esmenia O. is from Aneg, Delfin Albano, Isabela Province. She is 42 years old. Esmenia is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Esmenia O. Group.

Esmenia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Esmenia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. Raising pigs for fattening and for sale is Esmenia's main source of income.. She has been raising pigs for more than one year and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month.

In 2009, Esmenia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmenia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to buy piglets to raise. Esmenia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase more piglets. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Esmenia from ASKI.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Nei

texts.en:
Mrs. Nei Keom is 46 years old and she lives in Kdei Tnaot village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sok Sao, are farmers who own 1.5-hectar field to cultivate rice. In order to support the rice field, Mrs. Ne Keom decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, gasoline and to pay for hired labor. With the rest of the loan, she would buy pig food for pig breeding because aside from the plantation, she is a pig breeder. 

Mrs. Ne Keom, is the mother of three children, two of whom are students at the local school, while the youngest is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for a rice farm and pay for hired labor, and to buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mr. Sor S. is 46 years old and he lives in Krang Touch village, Takeo province. He is a duck breeder who earns income by selling eggs. Since his poultry business is doing well, he would like to expand it. Thus, Sor S. is requesting a loan to buy more ducklings for breeding to increase his income. His wife, Mrs. Satt Yorng, is a farmer who owns 1-hectare field to cultivate rice. They have four children, two of whom are employed in the garment factory, while the others attend the local school. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings

loans.name: Prosel

texts.en:
Prosel M., from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental, is 32 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Prosel owns and operates a specialized retail store whose revenue comes mainly from from buying and selling of ready-to-wear items such as shirts, pants, shorts, and any other goods according to customer demand in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Prosel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Prosel's second from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Helen B., from the village of Hinaplanan, Claveria Misamis Oriental, is 56 years old, married, and has 10 adult-aged children.
