loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and to expand her business

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia E. is 59 years old and a member of ASHI. She lives with her daughter, son in-law, and two grandchildren in one of the villages of the remote municipality of Pandan in the Antique province. As a mother, Eufemia’s dream in life is simple. She did not receive a formal education, but she has truly rich dreams. When her daughter was young, she dreamed of sending her to college, so she could graduate and have a better career. However, because of poverty she cannot blame her daughter for deciding to not pursue her own education. Instead of being upset and frustrated, Eufemia continuously supports her daughter and her family, hoping that her grandchildren will have a better life than what their mother had.

Now that Eufemia has joined ASHI, she is requesting her second loan, so that she can continue to grow the hog-fattening business she started with her first loan. After raising her hogs for four months, she will sell them, and the larger the hogs are, the higher price per kilo of pork she will receive and the greater the profit she will earn. She will then be able to achieve her dream little by little.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for her fattening business

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en:
I. Muhamad is 49 years old. He is married with two children. Muhamad has a small cafe where he sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. When he first started his business he only opened to sell breakfast because he worked at night. Once his place became more popular he was able to dedicate himself to the business full time. 

Muhamad wants the loan so he may invest in tables, chairs and utensils. He is asking for 4500 Somoni. With this money, Muhamad will be able to expand his business, to earn more profit and in turn help his children move forward to complete their school studies and further continue studying at the university. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Contribute to the growth of his business and they will be grateful.

loans.use: Tables, chairs, and utensils for expanding a cafe business

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
K. Rahima is 47 years old. She is married and has a daguhter. Rahima is a devoted mother that struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Six years ago she got an idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. She is engaged in this business together with her husband. 

Slowly the number of cows has increased and with them, her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 4500 Somoni. Be an important part of the growth of Rahima’s business.

loans.use: More head of cattle

loans.name: Akramjon

texts.en:
M. Akramjon is 27 years old. He is married with two children. Akramjon films wedding parties and other family occasions with a video camera. He has been in this business for about five years. Akramjon tries to be creative in his job and when shooting the event and preparing the tape, he works as if making a film for the cinema. 

In his neighborhood Akramjon is known as a very hard-working and diligent operator. He has many clients that make the business successful and bring a stable income to his large family. Today Akramjon requests $1500 US to purchase a new modern video camera and some other apparatus for his business. This is will be the first loan to Akramjon from IMON and he would like to assure everyone supporting him that he will repay the loan in time and expresses his gratitude to everyone.

loans.use: Video camera and other equipment

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
R. Mahmud is 36 years old. He is married with two children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs like: cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, detergents and many others in his grocery store which he built 4 years ago. Today Mahmud is requesting a loan of $1500 US to increase his stock. 

He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Expand grocery store inventory

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus is 37 years old and married, with a daughter who is in school. He farms and sells fruits and vegetables in a Masai village near Nairobi. He employs one person. With the KES 40,000 loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase a water pump and pipes for irrigation. His other source of income is his Boda Boda (motorcycle taxi) business. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping him improve his farming business and enabling him to purchase the motorcycle for his Boda Boda business. In the future, Titus hopes to have an improved business with higher running capital and a better standard of living. Titus would describe himself as "visionary" and "focused".

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and pipes for irrigation.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.en:
Abdusalom S. has been farming for more than 16 years. Together with his family he works hard in the field, hoping to have a good crop yield. He is proud of their farm because it allows him to feed and educate his family. Abdusalom wants to borrow $800 USD that will be used to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and will make a small investment in land preparation. Abdusalom was born and raised in Kanibadam, but he hopes his children can get an education and move to a bigger city. His main short-term goal is to make all the land he owns productive, as certain sectors have not been prepared for farming.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane S. is the 44-year-old owner of a small “sari-sari” (variety) store that sells products that people need every day in their houses. The income she makes from the store is used for its maintenance while the profits are spent for the needs of her family in addition to her husband’s small and sporadic income from being a carpenter. Despite their poverty, Mary Jane has been obliged to set aside savings for emergency needs once she became a member of ASHI. It was after she had taken out her first loan that she started to set aside savings. She realized the value of having saved money once when she needed money for the expenses of her children in school. The regular profits she makes out of her small “sari-sari” store were not enough to cover the expenses and so she withdrew from her savings.

After several bitter experiences because of poverty, Mary Jane is determined to work hard to grow her business and has taken the risk of requesting a larger loan through ASHI. She wants not just for her costumers to enjoy the complete commodities that her “sari-sari” store offers, but most of all for her family to have a stable source of income and have more money to put into savings. This is because Mary Jane wants all of her children to graduate from college and have better careers thereafter.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase inventory of goods and foods for her "sari-sari" (variety) store.

loans.name: Ijiang

texts.en:
Ijiang C. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase dried fish to sell. Ijiang is 35 years old and is married, with a husband who is a watch repairman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motor bike for the transportation of fish from the source at the river to the market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish to sell

loans.name: Gahvarkhon

texts.en:
Gahvarkhon S. is 53 years old. She is married, with two children. Together with her husband (pictured) Shahzoda, she has already been running the business for 15 years. She sells household products. All the goods are imported from neighboring cities. The business generates significant income for the family, allowing them to improve their living conditions. Today Gahvarkhon is requesting 9000 Somoni. She is going to spend the loan on purchasing new goods. In borrowing from IMON since 2005, Gahvarkhon has shown herself to be a reliable client with a good credit history.

loans.use: Purchasing household products.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 39-year-old single woman with three children, who all attend school. She sells charcoal and is also employed. Previously, she was employed in farming. With the 15,000 Kenyan shilling loan she wants to increase her stock of charcoal. She employs one person and operates within a Masai village near Nairobi. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, for helping her improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 26 years old and is married with two children aged 2 and 4 years. She and her family live in Nyabihu, a region of Gisenyi located in the Western Province of Rwanda. In this area, Fatuma sells secondhand clothes and the hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Fatuma is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business through purchasing more styles of clothes, especially those styles liked by young people. Fatuma hopes that once she adds those styles, the number of her customers will increase as well as her profits. With those profits, Fatuma will continue building a secure future for her family.

Fatuma is a hardworking businesswoman who uses her leisure time in socializing with her family.

loans.use: To buy additional styles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila E., currently in the business of selling charcoal from home, is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Laila is 35 years old, married to a chief, and the mother of six children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Makhsura

texts.en:
Y. Makhsura is 35 years old. She is married and has a son. Makhsura's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the home and of her little daughter. This was the reason that Makhsura decided to start her own business eight years ago, selling fabric for national dresses. Little by little, she has made her business grow and by offering installment payments to her clients, her orders are getting bigger. Now her business is running normally. However, she would like to continue bettering herself and her business. She is asking for a loan of $1,100 USD. With this money, Makhsura will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for national dresses. The power to help her business grow is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more fabric to sell

loans.name: Gafurjon

texts.en:
Gafurjon is 34 years old and lives in Isfara city, Tajikistan with his family. He has a retail shop where he sells spare parts for foreign cars. He has been involved in this business for more than four years. He provides the cars with spare parts and his family with food and other needs. Gafurjon has a great demand for his spare parts, thus he wants to buy more goods in order to be in requisition of his clients. He wants to take out an individual loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop inventory.  Gafurjon is happy about this loan and would like to thank everyone for the trust and support.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo tiene 51 años está casado con doña Marina Alba Gonzales, tienen 3 hijos (25, 22, y 19) años, son una familia de escasos recursos económicos, la hija mayor estudiaba una carrera profesional (Auditoria), pero la necesidad la obligo a salir del país para trabajar, se fue a trabajar a España, por lo tanto dejo de estudiar.

El señor Pablo y su familia viven en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de la maica central, tienen una pequeña casa propia con solamente 2 cuartos, en la todos de alguna manera tienen que estar cómodos.La actividad principal es la producción de la leche cruda, actualmente tienen 6 cabezas de ganado lechero, cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la producción de deferentes productos lácteos.

El préstamo será destinado para compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, con lo cual incrementara la producción de la leche cruda y con ello el nivel de ingresos aumentara y mejorara el nivel de vida.
Entre sus metas y sueños es realizar una construcción nueva de su casa en la cual tenga más habitaciones para que sus hijos puedan estar más cómodos, aumentar la cantidad de ganado lechero y que su hija vuelva de España y pueda terminar de estudiar su carrera.
texts.en:
Pablo, 51, is married to Marina Alba Gonzalez. They have three children (25, 22, and 19). They are a family with scarce economic resources. Their oldest daughter studied for a professional career (Auditor), but necessity obligated her to leave the country to work. She went to Spain to work, and therefore left her studies. Pablo and his family live in the city of Cochabamba in the Maica Central community. They have their own small house with only two rooms in which all of them somehow have to be comfortable. His main activity is producing raw milk. He currently has six head of dairy cows. He delivers his product to a business that produces different dairy products. The loan is to buy a dairy cow, which will increase his raw milk production. This will increase his income and improve his standard of living. Among his goals and dreams is to rebuild his house to have more rooms so that his children can be more comfortable, get more dairy cows, and have his daughter return from Spain and be able to finish her career studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanessa es una joven de 22 años es soltera, ella desde niña ayudaba a la madre en la con el cuidado del ganado lechero que tienen, ella desea independizarse y tener sus propio ganado lechero. Actualmente ella trabaja de día en el cuidado de sus 3 cabezas de ganado lechero y también ayudando a la madre y por la noche está estudiando una carrera técnica (CONTABILIDADA GENERAL).

Vanessa vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de la maica sud, ella vive con sus padres, su actividad principal es la producción de la leche cruda, cuyo producto entregan a una empresa que dedica a la producción de diferentes productos lácteos, actualmente tiene 3 cabezas de ganado lechero.El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, con lo cual incrementara la cantidad de producción de la leche y mejorara sus ingresos.

Entre sus sueños y metas es terminar se estudiar, temer su casa propia y aumentar la cantidad de ganado lechero y finalmente que en futuro cuando termine la carrera pueda trabajar de su profesión.
texts.en:
Vanesa is a single, 22 year old young woman. Since she was a young girl she helped her mother take care of the cattle that she has. She wants to become independent and have her own livestock. She currently works in the daytime taking care of their three head of dairy cows and helping her mother. In the evening she is studying for a technical career (General Accounting). Vanessa lives with her parents in the city of Cochabamba in the Maica Sud community. Her main activity is producing raw milk. She delivers her product to a business that produces different dairy products. She currently has three head of dairy cows. The loan is to buy a dairy cow, which will increase milk production and improve her income. Among her dreams and goals is finishing school, having her own house, and getting more cattle. In the future, when she finishes her studies, she wants to be able to work in her profession .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Ronald Michael

texts.es:
Ronald es un joven 24 años es soltero, hace 2 años que acaba de volver de España que se fue a trabajar , donde logro reunir lo suficiente para comprarse un taxi y actualmente trabaja de taxista y también ayuda a sus padres que se dedican a la producción de la leche cruda.

Ronald vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de la maica central, actualmente solamente tiene 3 cabezas de ganado lechero cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la producción de diferentes productos lácteos.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, entre sus sueños y metas es incrementar la cantidad de ganado lechero, ya que él quiere tener en un futuro una  granja grande como de sus padres, su meta más importante es terminar de estudiar la carrera técnica (CONTABILIDAD GENERAL) que no pudo terminar por que tuvo viajar a España para trabajar.
texts.en:
Ronald is a single, 22 year old young man. He went to Spain to work, and he returned two years ago. In Spain he was able to get together enough money to buy a taxi. He currently works as a taxi driver, and he also helps his parents with the production of raw milk. Ronald lives with his parents in the city of Cochabamba in the Maica Central community. He currently has three head of cattle. He delivers their production to a business that makes different dairy products. The loan is to buy a dairy cow. Among his dreams and goals is to get more cattle because in the future he wants to have a large farm like his parents. His most important goal is to finish studying for a technical career (General Accounting), which he could not finish because he had to go to Spain to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Mohamed A.'s Group

texts.en:
These gentlemen and ladies are staff members of a primary school in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 2002 and has a population of 109 pupils and 10 paid teachers.

This is the first loan this school is requesting from Kiva through SMT. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise have not being able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Mohamed A. K. (second from left) is a teacher at the school and head of this group. Mohamed is a 42-year-old, married, with 6 children – 2 in secondary school and 4 in primary school. Mohamed was born in a village called Paki Masaboh about 5 miles away from Makeni city. He has been both a teacher and a businessman. He has taught for 15 years and has been in business for 30 years. He relies on the profit he makes out of his business to complement his monthly salary. Mohamed sells local produce like rice and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With his share of the loan, he will travel to villages surrounding Makeni to buy palm oil and rice wholesale to sell in Makeni.

(Attached beneath are snapshots of members of this group who were not available for a group photo.)

loans.use: Buy rice and palm oil wholesale

loans.name: Scopas

texts.en:
Scopas L., currently in the business of selling green vegetables in the market, is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell. Scopas is 30 years old, married to a policeman, and has five children, all of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is 38 years of age and married with three children between the ages of 4 and 10 years. All her children go to school. She lives in a rented two-roomed house, where she stays.with five people. She has three meals a day. She takes care of additional family members. Her three greatest expenses in a month are paying electricity bills, school fees for children and rent for her residence and business premises. 

Cissy has a stall in Nalukolongo selling second-hand clothes and, besides this clothing business, she is a teacher by profession. She mainly sells on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She serves about 20 customers a day. She has done this business for six years now. Her main challenge is that there are many stalls that sell second-hand clothes. She has been with MCDT, a Kiva partner, for six years and is servicing her 12th loan, working with the same group mates for four years now. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en:
Ramadhan is 30 years old and is married with two children aged 3 and 8 years. Ramadhan, after facing a financial problem, thought of starting his own business. This business is the sale of foodstuffs including Irish potatoes. He started this business in 2000 and the hours of his business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Ramadhan is a proven entrepreneur and he spends a lot of time in keeping his business more stable as well as profitable. After realizing that his working capital in not enough for this purpose, he would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. He will use the loan to buy a large quantity of Irish potatoes and some other demanded foodstuffs.

If Ramadhan’s plan of increasing his business is successful, he hopes to save some of his profits in order to reinvest them in his business and to continue building a better living for his family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of Irish potatoes and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 43-year-old married man with three sons and one daughter, all of whom attend school. He has been running his women's and men's clothing business for two years. Previously, he was a cleaner. With the 35,000 Kenyan shillings loan, he hopes to increase stock for his business.

He is grateful to Kiva's partner Faulu Kenya for enabling him to provide for his family and educate his children. He hopes to buy land and be self-reliant in the future. Joseph describes himself as humble, cooperative and hardworking.

loans.use: To increase stock of clothing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 29 year old single man.  He offers a money transfer service named Omega, using the M-Pesa cellphone-based system.  He has been in the business for one year and has one employee.  He earns extra income working at a hotel.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to finance his business.  He has requested Kes.40,000 to top up his business's M-Pesa cash float.  He hopes to open more businesses and create employment for many people. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: Add cash float to his money transfer business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aling

texts.en:
Aling M. is currently in the business of selling onions,tomatoes and ground nut pastes in the market and is requesting a loan to stock beans and Irish potatoes to sell.  Aling is 36 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock beans and Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Terimbere Group

texts.en:
P. is 35 years old, married, with 4 children aged between 3 and 10 years. P. is the president of group called "Terimbere" and this group consists of three people, 1 man and two women. They all do the business of selling clothes in one of their local markets called Kigabiro. Their business is well known and this is their fourth successful year in this business. The hours of their business are from 6 AM until afternoon hours.

This group is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their business through adding more attractive and highly demanded styles for both sex. With these additional styles for sale, this group hopes to earn more profits which in turn will allow them to build a secure future for their families and make their businesses more stable.

loans.use: Additional styles of clothing for sale
